control_value: General Directorate of Taxes and State Property (DGID)
ministry_of_economy: Ministry of Economy, Finance and Planning
decree_info: Company registered in accordance with decree n°2016-123 of August 09, 2016 on the creation and organization of the Trade and Movable Credit Register (RCCM).
ninea_explanation: The National Identification Number for Enterprises and Associations (NINEA) is assigned by the National Agency for Statistics and Demography (ANSD).
ninea_requirement: In accordance with Article 3 of Law n°2013-10 of December 28, 2013, any company operating in Senegal must have a NINEA.
hosting_address: 340 S Lemon Ave #4133, Walnut, CA 91789, USA
copyright_text: All content on this site (texts, images, videos, logos) is protected by Senegalese and international copyright law. Any reproduction, even partial, is prohibited without prior authorization.
trademarks_text: OMA DIGITAL is a registered trademark with the African Intellectual Property Organization (OAPI).
gdpr_text: OMA DIGITAL is committed to protecting your personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Senegalese Law n°2008-12 of January 25, 2008 on the protection of personal data.
cdp_address: Fahd Ben Abdel Aziz Building, Route de la Corniche Ouest, Dakar
disclaimer_text: OMA DIGITAL makes every effort to provide accurate and up-to-date information. However, we cannot guarantee the accuracy, completeness or timeliness of the information published on this site.
external_links_text: Our site may contain links to external sites. OMA DIGITAL is not responsible for the content of these third-party sites.
jurisdiction: Any dispute relating to the use of this site is subject to Senegalese law. In case of dispute, the courts of Dakar shall have sole jurisdiction.
legal_questions: For any legal questions regarding this site
privacy_intro: At OMA DIGITAL, we place great importance on protecting your personal data. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, share and protect your information.
privacy_commitment: We are committed to respecting your privacy and processing your data transparently, in accordance with GDPR and Senegalese data protection laws.
privacy_policy_details1: This policy applies to all services provided by OMA DIGITAL, including our website, mobile applications and consulting services.
privacy_policy_details2: By using our services, you accept the practices described in this privacy policy.
data_collection_details1: We collect different types of data to provide you with our services and improve your experience.
data_collection_details2: Data is collected transparently and only when necessary.
identification_data_details: Name, first name, date of birth, national identification number (if applicable).
contact_info_details: Email address, phone number, postal address.
professional_info_details: Company name, position, industry sector, NINEA.
navigation_data_details: IP address, browser type, pages visited, visit duration, cookies.
communication_data_details: Exchange history, quote requests, messages via contact forms.
direct_collection_details: When you fill out our contact forms, request a quote or create an account.
automatic_collection_details: Via cookies and similar technologies when browsing our site.
third_party_collection_details: Information from our business partners or public platforms (LinkedIn, social networks).
data_usage_purpose: We use your personal data only as part of our legitimate activities and with your consent.
data_usage_main_purpose: Provide, maintain and improve our digital services (websites, chatbots, applications).
data_usage_communication: Respond to your requests, send you quotes and communicate about our services.
data_usage_commercial: Inform you about our offers, promotions and new services (with your consent).
data_usage_analytics: Analyze site usage to improve user experience.
data_usage_legal: Comply with our legal and regulatory obligations.
data_usage_security: Protect our systems against fraud and abuse.
data_sharing_policy: We never sell your personal data. We only share it in the following cases:
data_sharing_providers: We share your data with technical service providers (hosting, analytics, payment) who help us provide our services.
data_sharing_legal: We may disclose your data if required by law or to protect our legal rights.
data_sharing_business: In case of merger, acquisition or asset sale, your data may be transferred to the new acquirer.
security_practices: We implement technical and organizational measures to protect your data:
security_encryption: All sensitive data is encrypted in transit (SSL/TLS) and at rest.
security_access_control: Data access limited to authorized employees who need to process it.
security_backup: Regular and secure backups to prevent data loss.
security_audit: Monitoring and recording of data access to detect suspicious activities.
rights_description: In accordance with GDPR and Senegalese law, you have the following rights:
access_right_desc: Obtain a copy of your personal data.
access_right_details: You can request to view all data we hold about you.
rectification_right_desc: Correct your inaccurate or incomplete data.
rectification_right_details: You can ask us to modify or complete your personal information.
deletion_right_details: You can request deletion of your data in certain circumstances (right to be forgotten).
portability_right_desc: Receive your data in a structured format.
portability_right_details: You can request to receive your data in a machine-readable format to transfer it to another provider.
exercising_rights_details1: To exercise your rights, contact our Data Protection Officer (DPO):
exercising_rights_details2: We will respond to your request within a maximum of 30 days.
exercising_rights_details3: You also have the right to file a complaint with the Personal Data Commission (CDP) of Senegal.
cookies_description: We use cookies to improve your experience on our site.
necessary_cookies_details: Essential for site operation (authentication, cart, preferences).
performance_cookies_details: Help us understand how visitors use our site (Google Analytics).
marketing_cookies_details: Used to display relevant advertisements (with your consent).
cookie_management_details1: You can manage your cookie preferences through your browser settings.
cookie_management_details2: Note that blocking certain cookies may affect site functionality.
cookie_management_details3: For more information, see our complete cookie policy.
gdpr_commitment: OMA DIGITAL is fully committed to complying with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and ensuring the protection of your personal data.
gdpr_scope: This policy applies to all personal data processing carried out by OMA DIGITAL in the course of its activities.
gdpr_policy_intro: We have implemented robust technical and organizational measures to ensure GDPR compliance.
gdpr_commitment_details1: Our commitment to GDPR translates into a proactive approach to data protection, integrating the principles of privacy by design and privacy by default into all our processes and systems.
gdpr_commitment_details2: We regularly conduct Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs) for processing likely to result in a high risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects.
gdpr_proactive_approach: Our proactive approach allows us to anticipate risks and implement appropriate preventive measures.
legal_basis_description: We process your personal data only on the basis of the following legal grounds:
consent_desc: When you have given explicit consent for the processing of your data.
contract_performance_desc: When processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which you are a party.
legal_obligation_desc: When we must process your data to comply with a legal obligation.
legitimate_interest_desc: When processing is necessary for our legitimate interests, provided your rights do not override them.
right_of_access_desc: You have the right to obtain confirmation that we process your data and to obtain a copy.
right_to_rectification_desc: You can request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.
right_to_erasure_desc: You can request deletion of your data in certain circumstances.
right_to_restrict_desc: You can request restriction of processing of your data.
right_to_data_portability_desc: You have the right to receive your data in a structured format and transmit it to another controller.
right_to_object_desc: You can object to the processing of your data for reasons relating to your particular situation.
right_to_information_desc: You have the right to be informed in a clear and transparent manner about the processing of your data.
complaint_right_details: You have the right to lodge a complaint with the Personal Data Commission (CDP) of Senegal.
retention_periods_details1: Contact data: 3 years after last contact
retention_periods_details2: Contractual data: Contract duration + 5 years (accounting obligations)
retention_periods_details3: Marketing data: 3 years after last consent
retention_end_management_details1: Upon expiry of retention periods, your data is either securely deleted or irreversibly anonymized.
retention_end_management_details2: We conduct regular reviews of our databases to identify and delete obsolete data.
security_measures_details1: End-to-end encryption for all sensitive communications
security_measures_details2: Multi-factor authentication for access to critical systems
security_measures_details5: Regular penetration testing and security audits
transfer_policy_details1: We only transfer your data outside the European Union when necessary and with appropriate safeguards.
transfer_policy_details2: All transfers are made in accordance with GDPR requirements.
standard_clauses: Standard contractual clauses approved by the European Commission
breach_procedure_details1: In the event of a data breach likely to result in a risk to your rights and freedoms, we will inform you within 72 hours.
breach_procedure_details2: We will also notify the Personal Data Commission (CDP) in accordance with GDPR requirements.
breach_prevention_details1: We have implemented early detection and security incident response procedures.
breach_prevention_details2: Our incident response plan includes immediate mitigation measures to limit the impact of any breach.
cnil_contact_details2: Fahd Ben Abdel Aziz Building, Route de la Corniche Ouest, Dakar
mediation_alternative_details1: In case of dispute concerning the processing of your data, we encourage you to contact us directly.
mediation_alternative_details2: If you are not satisfied with our response, you can contact the CDP or use a mediation procedure.
continuous_evaluation_details1: We regularly review our data protection practices to ensure ongoing GDPR compliance.
continuous_evaluation_details2: Internal and external audits are conducted periodically to assess the effectiveness of our protection measures.
